comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: Jacob Ludwig Mathesheimer MD (man in the bowler) was based in Jersey City NJ; elected to the Medical Society of New Jersey in 1909; appointed lieutenant, medical reserve corps, US Army, July 1916. Emma Duensing (woman farthest right) died from meningitis and sepsis while on duty in Germany. She was born in Germany, trained at the German Hospital Training School in New York City, joined the Red Cross, volunteered for service in the Spanish-American War (she served in Puerto Rico and Manila); she was president of the German Hospital Alumnae Association, and treasurer of the New York County Registered Nurses Association. Because of her German birth, she was not allowed to go to Europe in an official capacity with the American Red Cross, and instead went as a volunteer. books.google.com/books?id=XIZBAAAAYAAJ&lpg=PA34&o...
